title: Drake Maye believes this Boston athlete should be getting MVP consideration
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "He’s doing whatever they need him to, and he can score the ball at will, and he does it nonchalantly.
" Drake Maye is one of the frontrunners for NFL MVP this season.
(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) Drake Maye is making a very compelling argument to win NFL MVP in just his second season in the pro ranks.

title: Why Mike Vrabel put his ‘arts-and-crafts’ skills to the test designing Drake Maye’s game ball
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "He better put it in the quarterback room because I put a lot of time and effort into that thing.
" Mike Vrabel and Drake Maye AP Photo/Greg M.
Cooper FOXBOROUGH – Drake Maye had an incredibly efficient performance in New England’s 42-10 romp over the Jets on Sunday.

title: Drake Maye admits he was playing sick during record-setting performance vs. Jets
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "Shoot, we battle the elements and came out with the win.
That’s what mattered.
” Drake Maye was under the weather on Sunday during New England's blowout win over the Jets.

title: Patriots receive some bad news over hopes of winning No. 1 seed in AFC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots would need a shorthanded Chargers team to beat the Broncos on Sunday evening.
Mike Vrabel and the Patriots have a slim shot at winning the No.
1 seed in the AFC.

title: A food writer’s predictions for Boston restaurants in 2026
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Restaurants It was another rocky year for Boston restaurants in 2025, but there's much to look forward to next year.

Among the Boston restaurant predictions food writer Katelyn Umholtz gives for 2026 is that there will be even more niche bakeries, like this Portuguese bakery called Flake that only makes pastéis de nata.
Tyler Santos/Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.
